Name: Menzacsata
Description:
Menzacsata sends you back to a typical Hungarian school canteen. You like it or not you cannot leave anything on your plate to go to waste, you have to eat it. The overly nice kitchen ladies keep the extra portions coming and your evil school mates try to get rid of their collection by tossing it on your food pile.

This is an easy to understand quick and fun card game. Each card has a color and a food on it. You start with three in your hand, no cards in your food pile, and one card in the common discard pile. The goal is to have less cards in your foodpile than the others when the deck runs out. In your turn you can play cards from your hand or your foodpile if the color or the food mathes the top card on the discard pile. You can continue playing cards until you don't have any that matches or you decide to stop. Kitchen staff, classmate and school pet action cards help you to get rid of your food pile, often by giving cards to other players.

Name: Sheep in Disguise: Goblin Expansion
Description:
This destructive 33 card expansion adds even more depth and strategy to the original or NSFW edition of Sheep in Disguise! Includes tricky Traps, sneaky Actions, and Sheep with special abilities to spice up the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sheep in Disguise: Wizard Expansion
Description:
This enchanted 33 card expansion adds even more depth and strategy to the original or NSFW edition of Sheep in Disguise! Includes powerful Spells, magical Actions, and Sheep with special abilities to spice up the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sheep in Disguise: NSFW
Description:
Putting sheep in disguises to protect them from deadly predators seemed like a great idea... until we lost all the sheep. Now a new age is upon us! With demand soaring, sheep are worth their weight in gold! Build your Flock, build your fortune, and protect it all from predators and opponents alike. NSFW artwork on every card!

Sheep in Disguise is a vibrant and strategic card game about protecting adorably-helpless Sheep from being devoured by the many outrageous and dangerous predators of the world. Collect Flocks of Sheep, keep them safe from Attacks, and use Action cards to destroy anyone that gets in your way!

Players take turns drawing cards to collect matching sets of disguised Sheep and a variety of powerful Action cards. When a player has collected 3 Sheep of a kind, they must be placed face up on the table immediately. This set of 3 Sheep is called a Flock. In a 4 player game, the first person to collect 4 unique Flocks is the winner.

On their turn, a player may use as many Action cards as they like by playing them to the Discard. They may also make one trade with the Field per turn. The Field is a constantly changing group of cards in the middle of the table that players can exchange cards with to help them build a strong hand. The Field guarantees that the game isn’t completely luck of the draw and allows the player to strategize and build combo moves in order to progress their game.

Players can also target an opponent's Flock by placing an Expose card on top of it. This Action exposes the Flock's disguise, leaving them vulnerable to an Attack! Players must choose to take the risk of leaving their Flock exposed or pay to remove the Expose card, ensuring the Flock's identity remains a secret. When an Attack card is drawn, all Exposed Flocks are destroyed!

Be strategic and be devious. If you play your cards right, you can turn the Attack card into an extremely powerful tool to help you get ahead... otherwise, you may end up as the victim.

If you find yourself falling behind, don't worry! All players are in it until the very end and one big move is all it takes to flip the whole game on its head!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monasteries in Spain (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
A 12-tile fan expansion for Carcassonne centered around the rich cultural heritage of Spain. As the nation with the 3rd most UNESCO World Heritage sites (48, as of July 2019, behind Italy and China), Spain is rich in monasteries. This expansion gathers the most important ones, together with a new way of playing.

Similarly to other expansions consisting in monasteries, the player will be given the option to play them as a regular monastery by placing a monk or as a Spanish monastery by placing an abbot, simbolized by a meeple balanced on its side.

Special rules apply to the Spanish Monasteries, which score points for having features in the 8 surrounding tiles. The more features around it, the greater the score. But beware, the abbot and the scoring of the Spanish Monastery will only happen once those features are fully complete. Should things not go as you hoped, don't worry, you will still get some points on end-game scoring.

Name: Anastyr: Unexpected Allies Expansion
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive: Adds four new heroes to the game

Tharn, the Lost One
Kshayesh, the Venom Master
Malka, the Wild Sovereign
Kosan, the Fearless Alchemist

Name: ジャントリック (Juntrick)
Description:
Juntrick is a trick taking game using the theme of rock, paper, scissors.  Players have to follow suit in playing a card.  If all cards are of the same suit, the largest card win.  If there is two suits, using rock, paper, scissors to determine the winning suit and the largest card wins.  If all 3 suits are in the trick, the first-played smallest card wins.

It has a deck of 36 cards in suits from 1 to 12.  Card 3, 6, and 9 has a bomb.  Whoever collects a bomb will score -4 points at the end of a hand; otherwise, each card collected worths 1 point.

Name: Angry Indians
Description:
Welcome to India where we pack a lot of chaos into an uncomfortably little space. This happens to make a lot of us angry. Manage your hand, and create and destroy parties made of the most loved and unloved Indian stereotypes. Is your Babban Berozgaar being attacked? Block them with your Nimbu-Mirch Force Field! Jealous of somebody’s party? Kidnap their Termineta! Hell, gang-up your attacks and get violent! And always keep your Nunchak Chappals Handy! It’s like real life, only without real repercussions.

Setup:
Everybody starts  with 3 randomly selected Member Cards, with each member having a starting health ranging from 3 to 5 and belonging to 1 of 8 classes, which are signified by colour. Everybody playing gets 5 Attack Cards for their hand (for their eyes only). The Attack Cards are what will be used by players during their turns to damage each others’ Party Members by matching class. There are also some Tactical Cards among the Attack Cards, such as trade, heal and block to add strategy to play.

Objective:
There are two modes to determine who wins:

     Last Man Standing: The last player left with any number of members in their party with any amount of health.
     First Knockout: The person with the highest Party health at the moment any one player’s entire party dies is the winner.


Gameplay:
During your turn you must play 2 actions. As an action you can either damage somebody else’s member, play a tactical card (among the Attack Cards) or discard and draw from an Attack Card draw pile in the centre.

Name: Hostil Hostal
Description:
You are a tour guide responsible for a group of 4 tourists that have travelled to the mysterious sites of Rocky Valley. Unfortunately, a landslide has forbidden your return home and you will have to stay for a few days. The only inn in town is the infamous Hostil Hostal, known for its intriguing past and deteriorating interior.

Your guests desperately need their rest but it will be hard to come by as you not only need to deal with the dangers of the hostel itself but also the insensitivity of the other guests.

Hostil Hostal is a strategic, entry level, family game. Players take turns placing guests in the beds of the different rooms of the inn. Each room brings different levels of comfort that will change according to its occupancy and deteriorating condition. Additionally, each guest’s rest will be affected by different events played in secret by each player. In the end, the player whose guests got the best sleep will be the winner.

-description from publisher

Name: The House of Wisdom
Description:
A lightly competitive research collecting and discovery making card game of shared progress.

You are scholars at the Baghdad House of Wisdom during the Islamic Golden Age. Starting with only a few Classical translations and the aid of a handful of great Scholars you will gather Research to make incredible Discoveries that will shape the world for the next thousand years. Each discovery expands the possibilities for all players to make even greater discoveries and awards you with Prestige that will ultimately mark you as one of the world’s greatest scientists and thinkers.

—description from the designer

Name: M.E.A.T.: The Cult
Description:
M.E.A.T.: The Cult is a card and board game in which the most important mechanics are: drawing, drafting and playing cards. Significant elements of the game are also: selecting tactics, in which players decide on the arrangement of cards, the order and type of plays, as well as randomness - random selection of cards and the use of dice rolls in the game.

The main goal of the game is to bring the opponent's (or the opposing group's) VITALITY points to 0. This process is possible due to the advantage achieved in subsequent game rounds.

—description from the publisher

Name: Planet Voyagers
Description: Each player manages a hand of five cards. Each round, players simultaneously play one card from their hand. The cards are revealed and resolved. Players earn points from the cards in different ways --- by moving their rockets across the solar system; by researching planets; or by receiving the points shown on the cards themselves. Hands are replenished at the end of the round. The first player to reach Neptune or to earn 12 points wins the game.

Name: Carrera de Palabras
Description:
CARRERA DE PALABRAS ES UN JUEGO PARA 2 a 4 JUGADORES DONDE SE VA A PONER A PRUEBA TU VELOCIDAD Y VOCABULARIO.

¡SÉ EL MÁS RÁPIDO!
Descarta primero tus pilones de sílabas, formando palabras con las sílabas del centro. En este juego los jugadores deben intentar ser los primeros en descartar todas sus tarjetas de sílabas. ¿La regla? Armar palabras con otras sílabas disponibles. Un juego para pensadores dinámicos.
Partidas rápidas para entrenar nuestro diccionario interno y nuestra agilidad mental.

PENSAMIENTO DIVERSO
Incluye cartas de imágenes que te obligan a pensar de otra manera; combinando diferentes destrezas mentales y formas de pensamiento.

---

WORD RACE IS A GAME FOR 2 TO 4 PLAYERS WHERE YOUR SPEED AND VOCABULARY WILL BE TESTED.

BE THE FASTEST!
Discard your piles of syllables first, making words with the syllables in the center. In this game, players must try to be the first to discard all of their syllable cards. Rule? Make words with other available syllables. A game for dynamic thinkers.
Quick games to train our internal dictionary and our mental agility.

DIVERSE THINKING
Includes picture cards that force you to think differently; combining different mental skills and ways of thinking.

Name: Signum
Description:
Signum is a drawless connection game for the hexhex board in the vein of Global Connection, but without markings on the board or an initial position.

Play: Players take turns placing one stone of their color on any empty hex.

Goal: When the board is full, the game is over and the player with the higher score is the winner.

Scoring: Each stone is worth 1 point for its owner if it is part of a group connecting opposite sides of the board, and -1 point otherwise.

The pie rule is used to balance the game: One player decides what the first move is, and the other player decides whether to play first or second.

The titular scoring trick that ensures there are no ties (each stone is either worth +1 or -1 points) was (unbeknownst to the inventor of Signum) discovered by the inventor of Loops 9 years earlier. That game expresses it even better: Stones that are not worth a point for their owner is worth a point for their opponent.

—description from the designer

Name: Paint the Roses: The Cheshire Kitten
Description:
"Hello gardeners, I am a kitten - The Cheshire Kitten! I love to frolic in a variety of shrubs. Can you plant my dream garden?"

In Paint the Roses: The Cheshire Kitten the Cheshire Kitten joins the magical world of Paint the Roses looking to play in shrubs with diverse colors and shapes. In this promo, you will get be able to advance the gardeners up to six spaces forward if you can create specific lines of colors and shapes the Cheshire Kitten desires.

This was a promo released for those who were a part of the early campaign email sign-up for the Paint the Roses Kickstarter Campaign.

Name: Jalopy Derby
Description:
Players bid, simultaneously, to race their Jalopies around the Checkpoint and back but beware: duplicated bids mean those jalopies take must take damage - and the more damage a jalopy takes, the slower it can move! However, guiding those jalopies are a variety of drivers each with their own special ability: let the fast-paced shenanigans commence!

—description from the designer

Name: The Frog Princess
Description:
Players are Princesses who have been turned into frogs and must catch the juiciest flies and kiss the Prince to remove their curse.

Each round, the cloud of flies is positioned away from the lily pad - where the frogs have gathered - and the players must quickly guess how far away (in matchstick lengths) the flies are away: the player(s) who guess closest to the correct distance extend their reach toward the Prince - the first player to reach the Prince by accurate distance guessing is the winner.

This game is an homage to the fabulous Froschkonig by Zoch.

—description from the designer

Name: Massive Darkness 2: Ingenious Shield Promo Card
Description:
A promo card that came with all-in sleeves.

The Ingenious shield can be used together with a two-handed weapon.

Name: Fou Fou Fou!: Je reviendrai
Description: A new card for Fou Fou Fou!. At the end of his turn the player must shout "I Will Be Back".

Name: Fou Fou Fou! PnP
Description: 28 new cards for print and add to the base game.

Name: Zombomination
Description:
Zombomination is an intense, post-apocalyptic, real-time or turn-based dice-rolling game that pits hardened Humans vs hungry Zombies. Asymmetrical roll options create  intense action and unique strategies for each end-of-the-world faction. Zombies and Humans also have multiple, and different, winning conditions to make each game an exciting experience that feels new. Do you have what it takes to win?

Humans attempt to destroy the laboratory or find enough supplies to win. Zombies either attempt to kill all humans or overwhelm the safehouse to win. Depending on preference, players can engage in hectic real-time action or more strategic turn-based action. Both zombies and Humans take actions when 7's or doubles show on two rolled D6. Most real-time games play in less than 5 minutes. Turn-based games take about 10 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Name: 적룡객잔 딜럭스 (The Red Dragon Inn Deluxe)
Description:
Korean deluxe edition of Red Dragon Inn. Includes all 12 characters of Red Dragon Inn 1,2,3.

- 1 : Deirdre the Priestess, Fiona the Volatile, Gerki the Sneak, and Zot the Wizard
- 2 : Dimli the Dwarf, Eve the Illusionist, Fleck the Bard, Gog the Half-Ogre
- 3 : Wizgille the Tinkerer, Brewmaster Phrenk, Kaylin the Renegade, Serena the Pious

In Red Dragon Inn, you and your friends are a party of heroic, fantasy adventurers. You've raided the dungeon, killed the monsters, and taken their treasure. Now you're back, and what better way to celebrate your most recent victory than to spend an evening at the Red Dragon Inn. You and your adventuring companions will spend the night drinking, gambling, and roughhousing. The last person who is both sober enough to remain conscious and shrewd enough to hold onto his Gold Coins wins the game.

Name: Tomato!
Description:
Throw your cards in the vegetables! Why? Why not?! Open the tomato, shuffle the cards, deal and off you go! TOMATO contains over 80 numbered cards from 1 to 10, which must be thrown into the open tomato in the correct order. Correct sequence? The rules are very simple: if the number on one of your cards is one higher or one lower than the top number on the discard pile, then you may discard it. The sequence 1 – 2 – 3 – 2 – 3 – 4 would be perfect! Easy right? Just always +1 or -1. All other differences are not allowed. But you have to be careful, because everyone is throwing wildly at the same time. And who wins? The first player to get rid of their hand cards wins. Understood? Then off to the vegetables!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: The James O'Brien Mystery Hour Game
Description:
The informative, witty, conversational, argumentative game, based on James O’Brien’s Mystery Hour on LBC Radio.

One player acts as the ‘Host’ and asks the trivia questions. Other players have to write their answers on their answer pad, or if they’re not able to do this, they can choose one of the two answers now given by the host. One true, and one false. The host can also choose their own false answer if they please.

Any player getting the correct answer without choosing the one given by the host gets 3 points, any correct answer from the Host’s choices gets 1 point. If players instead choose the wrong answer from the Host, the host gets 2 points.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end, OR the player who reaches 35 points on the score track before all questions are answered.

Name: Ever Aegis
Description:
Ever Aegis is a fantasy themed social deduction game, as well as a tactical card game. Choose 1 character among 30 characters, each with different abilities and play styles. You will be playing against your friends to be the sole winner.

Win in 1 of 3 ways:

     Have possession of 5 face-down cards.
     Eliminate all other players. To eliminate a player, flip 4 or more of their cards into face-up position.
     Some characters have a 3rd alternate win condition.


Each turn you will:

     Draw a face-down card each turn
     Use 1 of your 8 actions.


The 8 actions are as follows:

     Recruit: Gain 2 Soldiers. (No cards are needed)
     War: Go to war with 1 other player. (No cards are needed)
     Temple: Give a player a revealed card. The action corresponding to that card is Sanctioned. (Sanctioned actions are counterproductive actions.) 
     Mason: Discard 2 items in play or gain the Wall item (The wall protects only you from some actions). 
     Barracks: Have all players discard a face-down card.
     Treasury: Gain 5 soldiers
     Laboratory: This action is unique to each character. 
     Library: This action is unique to each character. 


Bluffing & Cards:
Cards are "needed" to use actions. You may use any of your actions, even if you do not have the correct cards, because you may lie about having them. As cards are revealed, it becomes more apparent who is lying.

War & Soldiers:
Players will have soldier tokens. When 2 players go to war, the player with the least soldiers, reveals 2 cards. Both players lose half their soldiers.

Items: 
Players gain item chits that act as passive or active effects in the background.

—description from the designer

Name: Kashi
Description:
In Kashi, each player uses members of various ganas to build temples to lure lord Shiva back to the city.

The game plays out on a small game board representing the map of city Kashi and its temples. On their turn, a player may discard a virtue card to move to the corresponding zone, place a card on the region they are currently located, build a temple by having the favour of the ganas. Together they work to get Lord Shiva back to Kashi.

—description from the designer

Name: Cavity
Description:
Cavity is a finite Go variant with an elimination goal – a bit like Mark Steere's Redstone, but without red stones.

Like Go, Cavity is played on the points of a square grid, and groups and liberties are defined the same way. 
An empty region is a group of empty points, and it is said to be adjacent to a stone if any of its points are.

Setup: 
Starting with Black, place one stone each on any empty point. 
The setup is over as soon as the players have one stone each on the board.

Play: 
On your turn, place a stone of your color on any point in an empty region that's adjacent to a stone of your color.
After placement, first remove all enemy groups that have no liberties, then remove all friendly groups that have no liberties.
In this phase, as soon as one player is the only one with stones on the board, the game is over and that player is the winner.

The game is balanced with the pie rule, or with pass-komi. Pass-komi is a whole number of points awarded to White as compensation for going second. White can spend such a point instead of placing a stone.

—description from the designer

Name: Paintbucket
Description:
Paintbucket is a flipping game of elimination for two players, White and Black. The game was designed by Michael Amundsen and Alek Erickson in 2022.

DEFINITION: A group is a maximal set of orthogonally adjacent like-colored pieces.

SETUP: Set up a chessboard using Reversi pieces in a checkered pattern.

GAMEPLAY: On your turn, flip an enemy group.

OBJECTIVE: Eliminate the enemy pieces.

—description from the designer

Name: Stalemate
Description:
Stalemate is a unique set of miniatures rules which captures the true flavor of World War I trench warfare.  Within this game system are elements as; hand-to-hand fighting, artillery vectors, machine-guns, flanking maneuvers, and much more.  It is the sincere hope of the authors that you derive many hours of enjoyment from this publication.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Złap mnie! Gra przygodowa
Description:
Tom has been trying to catch Jerry all day, will he finally succeed? …
Try and check, how easy is it to catch this smart and fast mouse!
Tom and Jerry. Catch me ! This is a simple game for the little ones, the children have to match the tokens with the right colors, to catch the mouse and win the game.
Playing in a friendly way teaches cheerful competition and develops logical thinking and insight.

Name: Monster Zone
Description:
Monster Zone is a card game that’s based off of luck, strategy   and skill. Each player will have a deck of monsters, spells and traps and both will battle until all life points are depleted are depleted which is a lot harder then you think.

The core of this game are the dice and defense points. The defense points protect the player from taking full damage from defense monsters, keeping the player in the game longer. While the dice are used to use the effects of most of the cards In the game.

It’s a fun strategy card game that can be hours of fun and entertainment!

Name: Quivit!: The Color Matching Card Game
Description:
Quivit is a simple and fun grid-based card game playable on any surface. Cards are arranged in a 5 x 5 grid with players rotating cards with random color squares to match adjoining cards with like colors to score points. Numerous optional rules are included to make Quivit competitive for all age levels.

Quivit the color matching card game is quick and easy to learn. 2-5 players take turns rotating cards to link colors, scoring the most points possible.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – The Exiled Dead
Description:
From the publisher:
- A warband expansion for Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, featuring seven morbid miniatures
- Includes a complete Rivals deck for out-of-the-box play and customization
- Contains over 70 cards, including 20 universal cards and 12 Grand Alliance cards for use by multiple warbands

The vampire Deintalos dwells in the darkness of Harrowdeep – a lurking menace eager to snare those who walk its labyrinthine passages. His experiences with the Force Dynamic – the arcano-electric force he believes animates all things – led to his self-imposed exile from Shyish, where his brand of necromancy is taboo. In Harrowdeep, Deintalos found an ideal place to hide his grisly experiments, aided by his mortal apprentice in necromancy, Marcov. Deintalos animates recovered cadavers with arcane machinery and the Force Dynamic. These Arcwalkers, as Deintalos dubs them, act in eerie unison to tear apart their foes. With their mindless assistance, Deintalos means to dissect every secret of the abyssal labyrinth in which he dwells.

The Exiled Dead are aggressive, but flexible enough to keep your opponents on their toes and play for objectives. Once you get your shambling fighters into a good position, they’ll be tough to tackle. To this end, Deintalos has an ability that will keep them all moving, activating multiple Arcwalkers at once. This box includes a complete Rivals deck, plus loads of extra cards allowing you to try out a few tricks, as well as universal cards and Grand Alliance cards to use with your other warbands.

This set contains:

- 7x push-fit Exiled Dead miniatures – no glue required to assemble, cast in a cadaverous grey to stand out even when unpainted
- 7x fighter cards, one for each warrior in the warband – Deintalos the Exile, the Prentice Markov, the Deadwalker Regulus, and the Arcwalkers Vlash, Bault, Coyl, and Ione.
- 65 cards to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, including:
– 12x Exiled Dead objective cards
– 10x Exiled Dead upgrade cards
– 10x Exiled Dead gambit spell and ploy cards
– 6x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
– 7x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
– 7x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
– 12x Grand Alliance cards, usable by any warband belonging to the specified Grand Alliance
– 1x Exiled Dead Warband Background / Rivals Deck Card

Name: Taphonomy: Dead or Fossilized
Description:
Through competitive play, game players learn about taphonomy (i.e., processes that affect an organism as it fossilizes). They explore how the organism’s biology, the environment it was deposited in, the physical and chemical changes during burial and decomposition, as well as discovery biases, can influence whether or not an organism is collected. Players attempt to preserve the best fossil collection by “time traveling” to the Jurassic; there they protect their specimens from taphonomic factors (either from random environmental events or other players) and learn what processes enhance or diminish preservation. Players then return to the present to recover their specimens and learn that collection issues can also bias sample recovery.

Developed by former Ph.D. student, Anna Weiss, and Dr. Rowan Martindale at The Jackson School of Geosciences at The University of Texas at Austin, play this educational board game at your favorite game night or as an educational tool in your classroom! The game can be played with 2-4 people (or more if you playing teams) and is fun for ages 12+!

Want to use this game in your high school or college classroom? Check out the Activity Description on the SERC "Teach The Earth" webpage; the board game is part of their "Exemplary Activities Collection".

Name: Hockey Score
Description:
A card-based game wherein two teams (2 or 4 players) play cards out of their hand trying to clear the board and score goals across three periods. The scorepad allows best-of-seven series of games.

—user summary

Name: Naughty R18 Cards
Description:
These naughty cards are designed just for the dirtiest little F*****s out there and they are definitely not suitable for all the Karens out there. The questions in these cards will shock even the kinkiest players.

GAME PREPARATIONS:
Mix the deck and deal paper and pens to all players. The youngest player starts and the game continues clockwise. The active player draws the top card of the deck and proceeds according to the category rules. Used cards are placed under the deck.

Winner is the one who reaches 15 points first. If two or more players reaches 15 points in the same round, the game ends in a tie.

Cards are well suited for bachelor parties, Christmas parties and wild get-togethers with friends. Naughty R18 cards can also be used separately without the main game

—description from the publisher

Name: Dual Dragon (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description: A new White Dragon is scaring Carcassonne. Play with 2 Dragons (a Red and a White one) that can both move and eat meeples during their path. The player who places the Dragon Tile decided which Dragon will move.

Name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods
Description:
This expansion features three new fighters from this world: Volhv, Zimorodok, and The Drowned Warrior. Each fighter brings new abilities to the worlds of Gatefall, and this team is a lot of fun to play.

—description from the designer

Name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Leshiy
Description:
Leshiy is the gnome of the woods, the shepherd of trees and plants, but he will join any side that has the coin to pay. Those that encounter him find that his allies are the woods themselves and that they are held fast and their fate is sealed...

A new character for Gatefall.

Name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Danika & Iva
Description:
The woods are enchanted, so the common folk say, but the most deeply enchanted part of the woods is the maze of hedges where the sorceress Danika and her familiar, Iva dwell. They say the hedges shift and move and devour those who enter them, and that those who try to hurt Danika soon find Iva there to protect her...

A new character for Gatefall.

Name: Nie puść Pawia!
Description:
Players meet to drink "lemonade" and to play this fun party game.
This is a party card game in which players take turns to play cards full of interaction between them. Each player has to play one card during their turn, after the card is played, players perform the action mentioned on the cards: swapping, drawing or discarding the cards etc.
There are no winners in this game - only one loser. The loser is the player who was forced to play the "PuÅ›ciÅ‚eÅ› pawia" card. The game ends after one of the players plays this card.
The game is humorous, and fun to play during the party.

Name: Pipo
Description: Pipo is an Alien party game for all Occasions! Simply play your Alien card and set and instruction based on the aliens features for the next player to match and then set their own. Quick, easy and for all ages, that's why its great for parties.

Name: ポロンちゃんのマジカルレッスン (Poron's Magical Lesson)
Description:
ãƒãƒ­ãƒ³ã¡ã‚ƒã‚“ã®ãƒžã‚¸ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ¬ãƒƒã‚¹ãƒ³ (Poronchan No Magical Lesson) is a memory game from Japan.

Poron is teaching you magic. You learn various magical spells, Fire, Stone, Wind, during Poron's Magical lesson. Each spell that Poron demonstrates on the cards has a colour combination, yellow, red green and so on.

Players are shown a number of cards face up, and given time to memorise them. Then the cards are turned face-down, but the order is not changed. A new Poron card is dealt up, and the players must identify which hidden cards have which colours.

If a player can correctly recall the hidden spell, and determine if it matches the new spell at all, they gain points. But if they make mistakes, they lose points.

The player at the end with the most points is the best student and wins the game.
user summary

Name: All Stars Playlist
Description:
Whether you are a DJ at a party or you just want to listen to some music in your pajamas, you can always use a good playlist in each situation. In All Stars Playlist it is all about music and making the perfect playlist. Songs in a playlist of course have to match. You cannot just add any song to a playlist.

GOAL OF THE GAME
Create the perfect playlist by putting songs in your playlist that match with each other.

Name: Squadron Leader
Description:
Squadron Leader is a fast pace World War 1 (loosely) themed aerial combat game that is easy to learn and quick to play, with multifaceted strategy built in that can be enjoyed by all ages!

The modular nature of the rules allows for players to customise their game and add entirely new layers of strategy.

—description from the designer

Name: Hush: Mellowvalley
Description:
April 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

     Map postcard: Mellowvalley
     Character card: Otto Copperbelly
     Nocturnal Creature card: Cole Wakefield
     Spirit card: Snake Spirit
     Structures card: Tent / Scarecrow

Name: Thornraver: Battle of Solus
Description: Thornraver: Battle for Solus is a two player (3 or 4 if you own two sets) game that expands the world out to the continent of Solus. Where Master of Wills was a cross between Tug-O-War and Chess, Thornraver is a cross between Risk and War (and of course, Master of Wills). This is an area control game in which both players begin with an HQ and two capitals. The objective is to gain control of the Population, Resources, Regions, Leaders and Districts. You can win by majority control or eliminating your opposition.

Name: Ashes Reborn: The Ocean's Guard
Description:
Tristan Darkwater, the Phoenixborn that only rumors have known, has finally risen to the surface to answer the call of the Phoenix in The Ocean’s Guard! Behold his power as he communes with the life of every being in the ocean.

Tristan uses sympathy magic and time magic to enhance the innate abilities of his ecosystem of oceanic creatures, as seen through his Magnify ability. He uses this power to specialize in swarming the battlefield. But Tristan isn’t one to sit back passively. When the time is right, he will unleash his signature move to clear a path for his tidal wave of attacking force!

This expansion deck is ready to play, or combine cards with your favorite allies and spells to create the ultimate Phoenixborn deck!
Families: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn

Name: Ashes Reborn: The Scholar of Ruin
Description:
Rowan uses ceremonial and time magic to excavate the physical and temporal ruins surrounding the historic battle site of Abylon. This original home of the legendary Phoenixborn Jericho is a powerful well of dormant magic, and Rowan will stop at nothing to harness it! Rowan’s pair of abilities allows him dynamic access to the powerful abilities of his closest allies, letting him simulate their life and death in an instant to reap the rewards of their lifetime of work! The ruins of Abylon’s outskirts are not easy to navigate, so Rowan will need many lifetimes worth of knowledge to make his grand discovery a reality.

This expansion deck is ready to play, or combine cards with your favorite allies and spells to create the ultimate Phoenixborn deck!
Families: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn

Name: Crokinole Cards
Description:
With Crokinole Cards, you will be able to play two new games on your crokinole board; Crokinole Solitaire and Crokinole Elimination. In Crokinole Solitaire, your skills will be pushed to the limits in order to survive as you play through its challenging levels! In Crokinole Elimination, a “last-one-standing” format is introduced where players compete to eliminate their opponent’s discs first. Both games are great for people of all skill levels, even if you don’t know the rules of crokinole.

Practice your shots. Improve your skills. Have a blast doing it!

—description from the designer

Name: Lunar Outpost
Description:
In Lunar Outpost, players work together to mine lunar elements and build a circular base on the moon. Players can choose to build a starter base, habitat colony, research center, or manufacturing facility. Each type of base is comprised of different "modules", such as a solar monitor or a machine shop, some of which allow the players to do more as the game goes on. The game also comes with a "training mission" to get new players up to speed.

Throughout the game, players need to contend with events ranging from oxygen leaks to meteorite strikes. A newly created Alexa skill serves as Mission Control, keeping track of the team's progress and announcing the special events for each round; players can also play offline using a deck of event cards.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Sucesos Argentinos: Hundimiento del ARA General Belgrano promo card
Description:
A promo card for Sucesos Argentinos about the sinking of the ARA General Belgrano in the Malvinas War, adding one more event for your timeline.


     Hundimiento del ARA General Belgrano

Name: Drill Bit Dwarfs
Description:
The competition in the Lorendon mining racket is fierce and only the strong have survived; the Drill Bit Dwarfs.
Now the battle for Honor between them has pushed the competition to the limit. Become a legendary drill bit Dwarf and take on your former brethren for the crown of the Driller King.

Drill Barter Conquer!
DBD is an action packed card-driven competition featuring drilling, bartering, deck building and sabotage of course!

Protect your mine!
Cut barter deals with factions to defend your mine and repair it.

Fill Faction Orders 
Factions Orders can reward both faction favors and honor.

Buy Enchanted Drill Bits
To build your deck, drill for gold and buy enchanted drill bits from the vendor.

Barter With Factions for Offense Strikes
Lorendon is home to powerful factions with a wide variety of offensive capabilities. 
 How To Take The Crown
Win by getting to 50 Honor first with your Mine still standing or when only one Mine remains, the Dwarf with the highest Honor wins.

- Solo VS AI
- Multiplayer 2-8 Players (Coop or Competitive)

—description from the designer

Name: Villain VS The Game
Description:
Villain VS is not a fair strategy game to have fun with your friends and family. I created the game and its backstory to test those who are truly obsessed with winning at all cost. Anyone can win a game with rules, heroes and endless comparable references.

What if winning meant you had to be the worst and not the best? What if your desire to win was more important than your skill or luck? Well now you can find out.  Can you capture and tame the worst Villains from our Realm and use them to survive till the end and beat your opponents? It won't be easy but it will be rewarding when you manipulate, cheat, lie, beg, borrow and steal your way to a victory in Villain VS.

Villain VS is a cutthroat, win at all cost challenge to any serious strategist to test their true skill in a game that requires you to work with and against other players for a chance to survive till the end and win the game. VVS is not meant to be a fair game.

Players deal and trade Evidence Cards in the first stage until they have the enough of the required Evidence Cards to capture an escaped Villain Card and build their Villain Teams.  Once all players have a completed Villain Team the Battle Stage starts. Players battle their Villains against the other player's Villain Teams until only one Team or Villain remains.

The player who survives till the end wins the game.

There is a companion Journal called "Journal #27 Creating VVS & The Singularity" explaining the history of the Game and its creation by Dr. Penelope I. Primrose High Priestess Coven of The Eternal and why she chose to trap the evil that bore our realm it's worst Villains.

Name: WORD TO WHO
Description:
Overview:
WORD TO WHO is a guessing game that consists of the most popular and widely used slang words and phrases from the Baby Boomer, Gen X, Millennial and Gen Z generations. Players compete against each other to see who can guess the most slang words and phrases. The player or team to guess the most right wins!

Game Play:
Players break up into teams and teams take turns, alternating players each round, with one player attempting to prompt his or her teammates to guess the slang word or phrase on the card. When your teammates guess the word or phrase you move on to the next card. The opposing team keeps a timer with each round lasting 1 minute. Each card is worth 1 point and the first team to 30 points wins.

Cards are color coordinated by level of difficulty, green cards are easy, blue cards are moderate and red cards are hard. Each card comes with a definition that players can use but players can come up with other hints, clues and definitions to help prompt their teammates to guess the word or phrase on the card.

Purpose: 
My ambition for WORD TO WHO IS to to promote social connectivity and build a sense of community across generations, cultures, communities, and cities. English is a language that is spoken all over the world and slang is a result of every place putting their own spin on it. My vision is to use slang as a way to forge ties of understanding, acceptance, and unity between people of different backgrounds.

—description from the designer

Name: A game about stuffing balloons as a team, without talking. But it's a card game - there are no actual balloons.
Description:
A game designed for release at UKGE 2022, to celebrate the fact that Bez would be literally stuffing games into balloons.

Players co-operatively fill 10 balloons with objects. Each object card has a weight and spikiness.

Each pile must have a card from every player, but most of them have to be played face-down! Also, you can't talk.

By using facial expressions and intuition, and learning the nature of the deck, you will learn what your teammates are likely to play and play better cards.

If any 'balloon pile' has a weight or spikiness rating that's too high, the balloon has burst, and the game is over.

Try to fill 10 balloons to win the game!

-description from designer

Name: Superclub: Powerhouses Expansion
Description:
For your club to rise, another must fall. Get ready for more epic highlights with fewer managers. The Powerhouses expansion replaces the Simulated matches (SIM) with matches against powerful opponents.

Test your team against 4 brand new clubs and get ready for 5 matches every season – with all the injuries and Game changers that follow – regardless of how many human managers are sat around the table.

The Powerhouses expansion includes a game board, game rules, season cards, formation cards, new players (both talents and stars), new key staff and game pieces.

-description from publisher's website

Name: The Constable (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
The constable is not a follower, but a special unit.

Each player adds a single Constable meeple to their stock at the beginning of the game.

The constable can only be placed on a road that already has a robber (whether a standard follower or the wagon). That meeple is removed from the road and returned to the owner. No points are scored by that player for that road. Should a road with a constable connect with another length of road which has a robber, that follower is also removed, with no points being scored. This same is true for any builder on the road. Should two road sections with constables be joined, nothing happens. At the end of the game, both players receive the full points.

The constable remains on the road until the end of the game.

The constable is not affected by the tower (being a royal servant itself).

The constable can be eaten by the dragon. If the dragon consumes the constable, return the dragon to a volcanoe and end the current movement phase for the dragon (it has retired to its lair to licks its wounds). The constable is returned to the players stock and made be played again.

A player cannot place the faerie in a tile containing her/his constable.

As the constable is not a follower, you cannot place your builder on a road with your constable.

Roads completed with a constable on them are not considered when determining the 'longest road'.

At the end of the game the constable scores VPs equal to the normal value of the road. If the road connects to one or more cities (complete or not) then the player scores one point for each tile that makes up that/those city(ies). If the road connects to a cloister, it scores an additional 5 points. (The tile with the well now becomes very valuable for the Constable, as it creates three endings and potentially more points).

Roads with a constable on them do not count for a point toward the value of the Robber Captain.

Name: Fluffy Frontier
Description:
The animals on Earth are not what they seem. Actually they are different alien types, secretly running the space agencies right under the humans’ noses. In Fluffy Frontier you play as these animals, going on what officially appears to be a man made space mission to Halley’s comet in 2061, looking for life and gathering samples for the humans’ tests. You have collaboratively traveled to the comet in a spaceship that is now parked in close orbit above it.

But there is more. You need to keep the great secret secret, not letting the humans realize that the Petsonauts are actually in charge of it all. While that charade is going on you’re trying to reach your own secret mission of retrieving certain alien supplies that your fellow aliens have sent to you using the interstellar transport system that comets actually are. Plan your strategy to find the needed supplies, smuggle these back to the ship, trade your finds with fellow animals, complete the necessary lab experiments, hurriedly competing to reach your goals before anyone else in the fluffy crew. And do it quickly, because the comet is heating up as it gets closer to the sun, increasingly releasing gas into space until it becomes impossible to operate on the surface. You have 5 weeks, make the best of it. May the fluff be with you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Battlecrest: Imperator – Solo Expansion
Description:
Somewhere along the line, you made a dangerous enemy. The Exarchy themselves have sworn vengeance upon you. Now their chosen champion stalks you at every step. Prepare yourself for the fight of your life as you face the mighty Imperator.

Imperator solo expansion enables gameplay for one player to play as any hero against any other hero using these 6 solo Command cards and that hero’s AI rules insert.


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chicken Crimes: il mistero del Dom Gallignon
Description:
Players impersonate Detective Gallo's team of investigators who receive a secret envelope containing top secret material useful for the investigation. The story begins with Gallo's video presenting the case to be solved, then the game develops in a cooperative way: the team has to explore the locations on the map by going to the relevant paragraph in the Book of Investigation. In this way they can gather information, interview witnesses, find secret objects and continue the investigation online by listening to audio recordings and viewing security cameras. Following a lead based on their own intuition and managing the money available (BEAK COIN) to access special locations and interrogations, the team must connect the clues they find to unravel the mystery and ultimately answer Detective Gallo's questions to score as many Victory Points as possible.

—description from the designer

Name: Autobahn: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter edition has "Kickstarter" printed on one of the shorter sides of the box and contains 3 mini-expansions, not available in the retail edition.

Autobahn: Wine Expansion:
The Wine Expansion offers the players the option of importing wine into Germany from its southern neighbours.

When trucks are loaded in France, Switzerland, Italy or Austria players get a destination card.

At the end of the game players scoring the trade department and having a wine goods token in their possession can add Germany to their list of delivery destinations.

Autobahn: Traffic Expansion:
With the Traffic Expansion traffic tokens block single-carriageway road sections around busy cities so that trucks cannot stop on them.

To remove the traffic tokens the players have to upgrade the jammed links to double-carriageway roads.

For every three traffic token a player removed they are allowed to promote one employee.

Autobahn: Services Expansion:
With the Services Expansion players can improve their service stations on upgraded links for building bonuses.

These upgraded stations grant their owners two bonuses instead of one when passing them with their own trucks and a higher money yield when their opponents' trucks are passing.


Autobahn is an economic strategy game about the building of the German motorway system over three periods of time spanning from the end of World War II to the present day.

At the end of the second period (in 1990), the Unification opens up opportunities to further extend the network into the eastern part of the country.

As a director within the BundesAutobahn Organisation, you are responsible for managing and developing the German Federal Highway System.

â€‹Aside from building roads, you’ll also be responsible for facilitating the transport of goods to neighbouring countries and constructing petrol stations to benefit from this new traffic.

As you contribute to the development of the network, you gain seats at the administration boards of each highway, and they will increase your budget at the start of each period.

Over the course of the game, your board members will eventually advance to more prestigious seats within the Bundesautobahn building, which instead will provide victory points at the end of the game.

Plan ahead to optimize your efficiency: Each contribution you make builds your reputation and gains you access to new departments and scoring opportunities that better align with your chosen path to victory.

â€‹The cards in your hand allows you to take actions on one of the 7 main Autobahns.
You’ll need to plan carefully and time your actions perfectly if you want to make the most of your hand before you need to collect your cards back.

Kickstarter Edition:
- Road Traffic Mini Expansion
- Service Station Upgrades Mini Expansion
- Wine Import Mini Expansion

Name: Battlecrest: Whispyr – Hero Set
Description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

A spirit born from the heart of the Fellwoods, Whispyr was bound to the world by the Dying Guardian. To fulfill her oath she and her familiar, Aura, must protect the Neververse against the corruption of dark magic. Ages of fighting against wraiths have given her a killer instinct and a knack for striking quickly before her victim can retaliate.

Components:

     Whispyr Hero set: 1 Hero, 1 Health, 1 Minion, 3 Action cards.
     Whispyr AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battlecrest: Forge – Hero Set
Description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

The powerful warbot Forge is a walking arsenal with something for every occasion. Few can get past its massive blast shield, which doubles as a surprise weapon to vaporize the unwary. This unyielding colossus has an unlimited capacity for destruction and not a single shred of empathy to slow it down.

Components:

     Forge Hero set: 1 Hero, 1 Health, 1 Item, 3 Action cards.
     Forge AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battlecrest: Expansion Collection #1
Description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Includes:

     Whispyr Hero set and AI sheet (for solo play).
     Forge Hero set and AI sheet (for solo play).
     Imperator solo expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Kingdoms Oak Campaign
Description:
WargameVault: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/415034/SMALL-KINGDOMS-OAK-CAMPAIGN
Awards:
-1 Place best game in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place best multiplayer game in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place best foreign language game in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place for best cover in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place for best set of written rules in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place for best theme in: 11th roll and write design contest.

The king is dead...

Since there is no successor, the machinery of power is moved by its own interests. General Ilante moves his chips behind the chancellors' backs to seize absolute power in the kingdom, but General Gurnard sees this as a betrayal and decides to act. Little Kingdoms: Campaign of Oaks, is a wargame style game where we will simulate the battles of the civil war of the kingdom of LUAN, we will take control of the army of General Ilante with the faction of the Royal guard or General Gurnard the Loyal to the throne. He fights for power and control of the kingdom.

The objective

In each battle the objective is the same. Destroy the enemy troops completely or generate the greatest amount of damage to the enemy army's morale.

Details


     Preparation time: 1 minute
     Play time: 20 minutes
     Players: Solitaire mode -Two players
     Ages: 10+ 


What do you need to play?

To play it is recommended to have:

     Only the sheet of the battle you will play, printed (It is recommended that the sheet be with a polypropylene protector)
     An erasable marker.
     Ten to Twelve 6-sided Dice 


—description from the designer

Name: Архитекторы. Зоопарк
Description:
Create your own amusement park!

Players every round connect new territory part to their own Zoo, draw roads to enclosures with animals, seating area for visitors and create picturesque ponds.

The game's aim is to design Zoo according game's aims and get the maximum points among players.

Name: Hakuna Matata
Description:
The buffalo is going - can the meerkats hold themselves on their hill, or do you fall down?
Game progress - To get a better overview, one curious earthman climbs on the hill after another
Obstacles - The hill wiggles through the buffalo. Fingertip feeling is required, because too much swing lets the figures fall down
Goal of the game - Whoever first placed all his figures on the hill is the winner. The game is also suitable as an individual activity

Name: Héroi'cartes: A la Poursuite de Barbe Crasse
Description:
Draw your cards and live your adventure!

You are part of the Detecteam, a team dedicated to protecting the world from super villains. In this new adventure, a bottle thrown into the sea will take you back to the time of... pirates! The terrible Dirtbeard has stolen the treasure from the Crabuga Islands, and only you can get it back! Let's go, boy!

To win the game, draw and discover your cards as you go along to advance your adventure. Choose your actions for a 100% fun single-player game!

Name: Swedish Parliament 2022
Description:
Every player chooses one of the six parties and play policies/opinions and move the party markers on a hexagonal voter map with 91 voters. For every card, the player gets to strengthen the relation between two parties who agreed, or weaken the relation between two parties who disagreed.

At the end of the game, the weakest relations are removed, until there is a government which has at least half the voters. The centre of gravity of that government is the winner of the game.

The game is 100% symmetrical, with inspiration from Sweden, although there are also special rules inspired by reality for those who want to play the Swedish election of September 2022.

Name: Escape Game Junior: Dans les Griffes de la Sorcière
Description:
You are prisoners of the witch Maléfys! Only one solution to escape: solve a series of puzzles and face his monstrous acolytes one by one. NO TIME TO LOSE, you only have 45 minutes! Luckily, DZ13 the robot is here to help you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tension: Foodies Edition
Description:
The sizzling hot foodies version of the popular Tension board game; from a Greek Salad to a Napoleon Brandy to a Pavlova, Foodies Tension covers all food & drink topics from around the world
    At the top of each card there is a topic and a list of 10 possible answers, the object is to see how many your team can guess in 60 seconds; the unique Tension score slider makes marking down the shout-outs so easy
    10 British cheeses; 10 types of cake; 10 herbs used in cooking, sounds simple but you have to get the exact 10 on the card
    Call out as many examples as you can and don't give up until the timer runs out

Name: Syzygies
Description:
You have an starting word.

And you have to write words that shares 3 consecutive letters with the previous one

And, also, you have a goal word.

Start the timer and get to the last one in less words than your opponents.

After each round if no one got to the goal, there is no scoring, but:

The player who got to the goal word in less words, doesnt score. In case of a tie, the player with less letters wins

The other players score 1 point for each word used

The game finishes when someone gets to 10 points, and then, the player with least points, wins

Name: ドロンビー (Dronbee)
Description:
In Dronbee, players compete to be the leader of a criminal gang of thieves.

Players will be drafting cards, both treasure and henchmen, from a central pool that forms a circle.  Players are obligated to take adjacent cards, and once one player has chosen cards, the circle shrinks.

Players place the cards taken into their "hideout" in numerical order.  Depending upon the subsequent situation, some of their henchmen may have escaped with some of the treasure, or the player may have achieved the goal of a mission card.

At the end of the game, players lose any treasure not protected by henchmen, and then the player with the most points wins.

Name: Word Duels
Description:
Pick an 8 letter word. This will be your life. Your opponent will do the same

Now, alternating turns, will choose a word to attack the rival one. This one can only have up to many consonants and up to many vowels as the attacked word.

Defend your word. Same rule than for attacking.

Hey, dont repeat words, it is forbidden

Name: Lost Temples of Qaarra
Description:
The Lost temples of Qaarra Await!
Over a century has passed since the catastrophe of Qaarra and the abandonment of its temples. The memories of these temples have faded to legends written on dusty scrolls. Adventurers could gain wealth and fame by journeying into the lost temples. However, who knows what mysteries and dangers might lurk there!

Lost Temples of Qaarra is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, featuring:


     New d66 dungeon tiles.
     New room features.
     Lower dungeon floor levels.
     New mechanics for Stairs, Scrying Pools, Altars.
     New magic items including the Rod of Resurrection.
     New monsters: tainted aspect, crystal guardian, hairy mimic, meat-eating moss, flying reptiles, temple automatons, cursed corpse, archdaemon, stone terror, gigantic gorilla, temple cleaner, cursed priest and more!
     A new Final Boss type, the temple guardian.
     New traps, scrolls, secrets and treasure.
     Hardcore play rules for die-hard players.
     Two new classes: the artificer and the crystalmancer.

Name: The Long Road: Fatherland Expansion
Description: Fatherland is a complete, boxed expansion for The Long Road that brings the forces of the Bundeswehr, including their devastating Leopard I and Leopard II tanks, to the Long Road system. Additionally the expansion includes a new, mounted map board, a full sheet of counters, and six brand new scenarios.

Name: Court of the Pixie King
Description:
Enchanted Meadows Await!

Enter the realm of the fairies, both bright and beautiful and dark and foreboding. A battle for the rule of all feydom is fought by the benevolent Seelie and the malign Unseelie. Who will win the crown and what role will your party play?

This book includes Fairy Lore, Fey and Gnome Expert Skills, New Reaction: Mischief, Two New Dungeon Tile Sets, New Classes (Faery and Bog Fly), New Monsters, Spells and Magic Items, Toadstool Rings and Tree Hollows, Enchanted Mushrooms, New Gnome Gadgets, Traits, Milestones, Mutations, Six New Druid Spells and a New Patron.

Name: Curse of Castle Ravenstein
Description:
This is a quick dungeon in card format co-produced by PocketLands and Ganesha Games.

Each deck is a standalone thematic dungeon to explore including its own quest, unique monsters and magic treasures. Fully compatible with “Four Against Darkness” game.

It is an official product for Four Against Darkness, and the core Four Against Darkness rulebook is required to play.

The deck contains:

17 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards
2 unique monster cards
2 unique magic item cards

Name: War of Salus
Description:
A hex grid war game that utilizes a dice-based action mechanic alongside largely deterministic combat to put as much agency in each player's control.

Player's fight for control over command posts and to destroy each other's power generators while also managing their own reinforcements, shared defensive abilities, and each unit's unique abilities.

—description from the designer

Name: La Bataille d' Heilsberg 1807, Bloody Prelude to Friedland
Description:
La Bataille d’Heilsberg 1807 recreates the almost forgotten, but extremely bloody battle for the East Prussian Teutonic castle town just four days before (June 10, 1807) the decisive battle of Friedland. While the French were under the oversight of the Emperor Napoleon, their forces at Heilsberg were under the command of Marshal Joachim Murat and Marshal Jean-de-Dieu Soult. Both Marshals frontally assaulted the well-prepared defenses of the Fourth Coalition around the old Teutonic Knights town of Heilsberg in East Prussia. The commander of the Coalition forces was Graf von Bennigsen, a Hanoverian general in service to the Russians. Bennigsen had spent months fortifying the area around Heilsberg with redoubts; fleeches; and assorted abattises surrounding the old Teutonic Knights castle in Heilsberg itself. It was probably the best-fortified position of any Napoleonic battlefield. Napoleon had 85,000 troops in the immediate area on June 10 facing Bennigsen’s 90,000 Russians and Prussians. The battle lasted nearly 12 hours and consisted of a series of cavalry charges and French frontal assaults on the well-defended Coalition positions. There were 20,000 casualties in the battle.

The game will has two large maps; over 700 counters and assorted player aides, including a virtual 160-page rules and historical commentary book.
Families: Series: La Bataille (Marshal Enterprises / Clash of Arms Games)

Name: MORFINS
Description:
MORFINS is a set-collection game for exactly 4 players.

The players each start with 4 cards in hand; on their turn, a player can initiate a round of passing, swap cards with the center, or exit the round.

Once a player has exited the round, the other players have up to 2 additional turns, and then the players score their hands.  The player with the largest set (for instance, 4 of a kind) receives 2 chips from the player with the lowest set.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

Name: Try!Angler
Description:
In Try!Angler, the players, as fishermen, fight against government restrictions to catch their dinner.

On a player's turn, they draw a line across four boards which make up an image of the ocean. If the line completes a triangle, the player writes their initials in the triangle, marking their ownership.

Some of the contents of a triangle will grant a player positive points and some negative.

Once no additional lines can be drawn, the player with the most points wins.

Name: Prison (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description: The Sheriff meeple will capture one opposing thief on the road and will send them to the Prison for 6 turns. All the other thieves on the road will run away, back to players' supplies.

Name: Iaijutsu
Description:
Theme
2 Players are catapulted in a Japanese samurai movie right at the very beginning of a duel, they must follow the cinematic canon:
-the talk: a bluff game
-the stare: a resource management game
-the fight: outsmart your opponent 
No part is more important than the others and the outcome is never given for granted where honour is as important as blood.

Mechanics and Components
This game it's all comprised in 15 tarot size cards and 30 tokens, but don't let the size fool you, it's a mid to heavy game of bluff, resource management and out-thinking the opponents intentions.

To whom the game is intended
The game is for heavy card gamer as CCG and LCG players (especially Netrunner players) and all players that enjoy to think deeply on the consequences of they moves.

To whom this game is not intended
Casual players, one-of players, multi-players solitaire lovers

Why PNP
I think this game is so minimal in its components that betrays its expectations by providing an deep and unforgiving (and I hope unforgettable) play experience. Given this characteristics it becomes hard to sell as a physical product therefore decided to release it as a PNP.

—description from the designer

Name: Flick Forts
Description:
In Flick Forts, players take charge of an endearing team of well-intentioned but poorly trained fantasy characters, each vying for battlefield control.

Characters are represented by poker chips that form a player's starting fort. Each turn, players take a character from their fort and use the chip to attack the opponent, Crokinole-style, or to build a defence.

Akin to curling, attacking characters will score points for ending the game in their opponent's endzone. Knocking chips from the enemy fort will reduce an opponent's character pool, and defences left standing at the end of the game will earn bonus points.

Flick Forts can be converted from basic to advanced mode (featuring asymmetric character abilities focusing on different dexterity playstyles) in under 5 seconds, and features language-independent gameplay components.

The chip-flicking, tower-toppling excitement of Flick Forts is perfect for friendly, head-to-head battles or grudgematch-style tournament play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crime Scene: ISS Excalibur 2049
Description:
ISS Excalibur is the sixth game in the Crime Scene family. It follows the same mystery solving format as its predecessors, but is set in the near future in an international Space Station.
The puzzles range from fairly light ones to quite challenging ones, and the showcase some very nice and new mechanics. The story is again written by awarded author Arttu Tuominen, and the only way to get to read the finish, is by solving the puzzles!
The high age recommendation comes from a few graphic details in the story. These can be skipped by parents playing with their children (12+), as long as they are aware such exist in the game.

Challenge Level 4/5

Name: Conroi: The Medieval Card Game
Description:
A true tactical card game were every card matters.
Realistic and deep gameplay yet Easy to learn.

Use real battle tactics to outmaneuver your enemy or simply try to overpower them by sheer numbers.

In this card game consisting of 72 cards, two players fight across the battlefield in an attempt to win a best of five rounds.

Each player has 27 differently designed highly detailed Soldier cards and 9 Tactics cards all with quality artwork.

Use your cards at your disposal in the most effective way to undermine your opponent or take them out by outsmarting them.

The game is designed for fans of historical battles and strategic gameplay were no game plays out the same way.

—description from the designer

Name: Siege Command: The Conclave Wars
Description:
Siege Command’s first expansion: The Conclave Wars brings three new Tribes into the fray. Not only do each of these Tribes introduce asymmetric gameplay, but they also bring unique mechanics that deepen the gameplay and strategy. The expansion also includes new optional Terrain types that can be used to further deepen the game’s strategy.

—description from the designer

Name: Catchy Match
Description: Catchy-Match is above all a rough backyard soccer field spectacle than a slick Champions league Cup match. Here, two proud character teams challenge each other, betting on who can most trickily use their opportunities to score a goal. If only there wasn't the matter of luck. The dice decides which possibilities there are and sometimes it also prevents the victory that was thought to be certain. Especially people who are enthusiastic about the game and don't know anything about soccer can quickly get ahead of the game and show the supposed soccer pros how to win a match.

Name: Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares – Bone Hunters Expansion
Description:
A set of eight dice and one instruction card for Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares. The Bone Hunters Expansion was part of the deluxe edition through Fox Tale Games's Kickstarter campaign, but is now available as a separate expansion for the retail version of the game.

These dice are extremely powerful but extremely dangerous, so use them wisely!

Name: Dipsticks: Names
Description: This is clearly intended as an implementation of Charades. There are no rules supplied with this "game" other than the package blurb: "Dip in, pick a stick and have a laugh! Describe famous names for your friends and family to guess."

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Nemesis Promo Pack
Description: Nemesis Promo Pack featuring five Super Heroes and Super-Villains: Red Hood, King Shark, Starfire, Hawkgirl, and Raven.

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Character Promo Pack
Description: Character Promo Pack featuring four oversized Characters: Lobo, Supergirl, Green Lantern (Jessica Cruz), and Solomon Grundy.

Name: DC Deck Building Game: Anniversary Promo Pack
Description: Anniversary Promo Pack including all 15 cards that came before 2022.

Name: Loot Dispute
Description:
A group of adventurers has just left town after clearing out a nearby dungeon. The townsfolk have worked up the courage to go see what valuable loot they may have left behind.

An asymmetric grid of cards featuring different types of loot is laid out. The first player splits the grid along any single straight line between cards, claiming one set of loot cards for themselves.

Each successive player can choose to further divide any pile in play. If another player has laid claim to the pile you choose to split, that player is "kicked off" that pile of loot and will take another turn. If turn order returns to you without you having been kicked off your loot selection, you keep those cards.

Once everyone has collected their loot, and organized it by color, players draft a merchant card, each with different scoring mechanisms.  Each merchant is assigned to a color of loot, with their scoring mechanism only counting towards the loot collected in that color.

Players move to the next room in the dungeon (represented by a new loot card configuration being laid out) and repeat the process of cleverly splitting loot and looking to draft the most useful merchant.

After 5 rooms of loot have been split, players score each color of loot based on the merchant assigned. Most points wins!

-description from publisher

Name: Pagan: Kickstarter Exclusive Content
Description:
Exclusive Kickstarter Content.

Contains:
21 Villager cards
21 Suspect cards
7 Villager overview cards
7 Scenario cards
3 wooden Hunter action pawns
3 wooden Witch action pawns
30 wooden Gloom tokens
30 wooden Clue tokens
30 wooden Secret tokens
20 wooden Favor tokens
9 wooden Evidence tokens
4 Action cards
3 cloth bags
1 metal coin
3 content packs (each with 32 action cards)

Name: BN1: A Board Game All About Brighton (10th Anniversary Edition)
Description:
You and up to three friends must travel the length and breadth of the city, looking for interesting things to do and see. And adventure can be found in the most unlikely places.

Will you hike out to the Chattri, lounge in the Pavilion Gardens or see a film at the Duke of York’s? Take part in Paddle Round The Pier or watch the Pride procession? Learn about Martha Gunn or Disco Pete? Or will you go busking, picnicking, shopping and exploring until it’s time to go home?

For 2-4 players, take turns moving around the labyrinthine streets of the city, having encounters, buying useful equipment and exploring destinations. Visit city events and local sites of interest on the way, scoring extra points in the process. The first player to score 50 points and get themselves back to Brighton station wins the game.

You can play the game as a roll-and-move, or with sets of action cards that are unique to each player.

—description from designer

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Dimir Rogues
Description: This 60-card deck is tournament-ready and playable right out of the box. Fan-favorite cards from Zendikar Rising, Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths, Theros Beyond Death, Throne of Eldraine, and Core Set 2021, the Dimir Rogues Challenger Deck is forged from some of the most powerful strategies in Standard. Force your opponent to mill cards and reap the benefits of their expansive graveyard.

Name: Archery Tournament (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
Once a year, the townsfolk of the county of Carcassonne gather for the annual archery tournament.
This tournament sees the best archers from all over Europe demonstrating their skill in the hopes of
becoming the champion archer. But there can only be one champion, so second place simply won’t
do.

The new Archery Champion (the player with the majority of Farmers in the field with the Archery Range) will earn 4 points for each completed city in that field.
